Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in its natural habitat and label the fish.
The student can include and label other living things that might be found in the same habitat as the fish.
The student can label the water as a critical resource that fish need to survive.
The student can accurately represent and label the relationship between the fish and its habitat (such as fish needing water to swim).
The student can label the different parts of the fish's habitat, noting where it gets its resources like food and oxygen.
The student can illustrate how the fish and its habitat are part of a larger system, for example, by showing how plants in the water provide oxygen.
